gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

abstract.gco:CharacterString: LAI was defined by CEOS as half the developed area of the convex hull wrapping the green canopy elements per unit horizontal ground. This definition allows accounting for elements which are not flat such as needles or stems. LAI is strongly non linearly related to reflectance. Therefore, its estimation from remote sensing observations will be scale dependant over heterogeneous landscapes. When observing a canopy made of different layers of vegetation, it is therefore mandatory to consider all the green layers. This is particularly important for forest canopies where the understory may represent a very significant contribution to the total canopy LAI. The derived LAI corresponds therefore to the total green LAI, including the contribution of the green elements of the understory. The product at 333m resolution is provided in Near Real Time and consolidated in the next six periods.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of the Copernicus Land service. It can be also useful for all applications related to environment monitoring.

credit.gco:CharacterString: LAI products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The product is based on Sentinel-3 333m data (copyright EU Copernicus and distribution by ESA).

deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona, Edifici C

otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

LENGTH_AFTER (length of semi-period after product date)

positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe and Africa. When ordering products from the online archive or subscribing to receive future products, users are informed via e-mail whenever the requested products are ready to be downloaded on the FTP server.

description.gco:CharacterString: Information on how to search, download, order products or subscribe to future products
Register to receive products via EUMETCast telecom satellite

title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

statement.gco:CharacterString: The input data are the instantaneous Sentinel-3 Top of Canopy reflectances. The reflectances are first used to calculate instantaneous estimates of the products using a neural network. Then these instantaneous values are smoothed and gap-filled over a compositing window, that can be asymmetric, and taking into account the land cover type (Evergreen Broadleaf Forest or not).
